panels.description: Throughput of logprep in events per second.
panels.title: Throughput

panels.description: Duration of all connector and pipeline processing times combined.
panels.title: Total Processing Times

panels.description: Processing times of input connector. When using kafka input connector then 100 ms is equivalent to the timeout of the input connector, meaning no new messages were fetched.
panels.title: Input Processing Times

panels.description: Average over all processors when actively working (matched rules).
panels.title: Processor Processing Times

panels.description: Is the sum of the whole pipeline: parsing event, passing it through the pipeline and sending it to the output connector.
panels.title: Pipeline Processing Times

panels.description: Average processing times of all output connectors
panels.title: Output Processing Times

panels.description: The increase of number of errors in the selected time range
panels.title: Errors

panels.description: Shows the currently active logprep version.
panels.title: Logprep Version

panels.description: Shows the currently active config version of logprep, if specified.
panels.title: Config Version

panels.description: The increase of incoming events over the selected time frame.
panels.title: Incoming Events

panels.description: The increase of outgoing events in the selected time frame.
panels.title: Outgoing Events

panels.description: Shows the absolute and relative change between the output and input connector. If using one input and output connector then the relative difference should be close to 1, except for deleted events. When using two outputs and only one input the relative difference should be around 2, because every event will be send to two outputs.
panels.title: Input/Output Difference

panels.description: The count of the number of rules at the last moment of the selected time frame.
panels.title: Number of Rules

panels.description: The increase of number of SREs in the selected time range
panels.title: Number of SREs

panels.description: The increase of number of warnings in the selected time range
panels.title: Warnings

panels.description: Shows the current config refresh interval.
panels.title: Config Refresh Interval

panels.description: Shows the number of config reloads in the selected time frame.
panels.title: Config Reloads

panels.description: Shows the average processing time of the confluent kafka input over the selected time frame.
panels.title: Processing Times for kafka input

panels.description: Shows the average processing time of the opensearch output over the selected time frame.
panels.title: Processing Times for opensearch output

panels.description: Shows the average processing time of the confluent kafka output over the selected time frame.
panels.title: Processing Times for kafka output

panels.description: Number of events that had an error during processing and which were send to the error output/index.
panels.title: Failed Events

panels.description: Number of garbage collections per second
panels.title: GC/s

panels.description: Number of objects that were collected by the garbage collector.
panels.title: collected/s

panels.description: Currently assigned kafka partitions
panels.title: Partitions

panels.description: Number of unsuccessful Kafka commits
panels.title: Commit failures

panels.description: Number of successful Kafka commits
panels.title: Commit success

panels.description: Shows the per-second average of processed events per connector.
panels.title: Processed Event Rate per Connector per Second

panels.description: Shows the difference between processed and failed events as a per-second average. Failed events are events that couldn't be parsed or where processors/rules canceled the processing due to an error.
panels.title: Success/Failed Event Rate per Output per Second

panels.description: Shows the processing time per connector
panels.title: Processing Time Per Connector

panels.description: Committed and current offsets reported by the librdkafka library
panels.title: Offsets

panels.description: Shows how many message the underlying kafka client received as a per-second average.
panels.title: Recieved Messages in librdkafka

panels.description: Shows how many message the underlying kafka client transmitted back to kafka as a per-second average.
panels.title: Transmitted Messages librdkafka

panels.description: Shows the rate of the kafka consumer group rebalancing of the input connector
panels.title: Rate of Input Connector Rebalancing

panels.description: Shows a per-second average of the applied rules, aggregated by processor.
panels.title: Rate of Applied Rules per Processor per Second

panels.description: Shows the processing times of matched rules.
panels.title: Processing Times per Processor per Second

panels.description: in relation to each other
panels.title: Processing Times per Processor per Second

panels.description: Shows the processing times of matched rules aggregated for each processor. If processor is missing then no data is available in the selected time frame
panels.title: Avg Processing Times per Rule-Type

panels.description: Shows the processing time of applied rules as a heatmap. The y-axis shows buckets of a histogram and the color intensity shows how many rules where applied per bucket.
panels.title: Rule Processing Times

panels.description: in the selected time range
panels.title: Number of Errors

panels.description: in the selected time range
panels.title: Number of Warnings
